title: Animals Eat Ocean Plastic Because it Smells Like Food
body: In 2014, a global analysis measured ocean plastic at a quarter of a billion metric tons, much of it suspended in small rice-sized particles. More than 200 animal species have been documented ...
readable_content: - **User** (2023-12-08): I found an interesting article about a new study explaining why marine animals are consuming plastic debris. It seems that the plastic emits a smell similar to the food marine animals are searching for, leading them to consume it inadvertently.
summary:
The information about marine animals consuming plastic debris is alarming and highlights the urgent need to address plastic pollution in our oceans. It's concerning to learn that the smell emitted by plastic can entice marine animals to ingest it. Efforts to reduce plastic waste and implement more sustainable practices are crucial in mitigating this issue. 

Sentiment: 0.8
